The bridge, originally built in 1804, had undergone several restorations and renovations over the years, but these efforts had often prioritized aesthetics over structural integrity. The cumulative effect of these decisions had left the bridge vulnerable to the ravages of time and the weight of its own popularity. In the aftermath of the 2015 incident, the City of Paris was forced to confront the reality of Pont des Arts' endommagement. The bridge was closed for repairs, and a comprehensive restoration project was launched to address the underlying issues.
